reviews.review_msg: A very tenured professor, he is well-versed in the subject and extremely knowledgeable. Examples/lecture notes don't translate 1-to-1 on exams and the lecture material tends to be fairly dense. He spoke with an accent but is comprehensible. If you try to understand the "big" ideas over the details, you will be able to understand exam questions.
Very professional. Explains things down to the details
Expecting to learn nothing from the class.
Paul ho is a daily reminder that I could be better in life. I strive to be like him and make a name as prestigious as his in the engineer world. his English is amazing and his mom is fine af
What he taught in the lecture differs from assignment and exam. His note is useful but hard to understand. Easy midterm and final if you study the sample exam.
Horrible Prof. Doesn't know how to teach. Even TA's couldn't understand his exams. Couldn't communicate with the students, literally...

Paul Ho, in a few words, is a clear speaker yet if you are in class, you need to ask questions because there is a lot of concepts that he may assume you already know. As a second year student, who took this third year course, I did struggle to some extent. The exam was not easy for me. If you are a 2nd year I recommend waiting to take it later.

Just because he gives easy grades does not necessarily means he is a good prof. The lectures are not useful, and not enough examples are used. I had better luck understanding theories by watching Youtube lectures.

Paul Ho is an excellent professor. Not only is he good at delivering difficult concepts he is also good at keeping the class alive. I did not need the textbook at all. Received an A+. Thanks for a great class!
if you try a little harder you will easily get an A+ with this prof
One of the best profs at sfu engineering. Very clear in explaining the material. Very logical and experienced. Thank you.

His notes are really tough to understand and look back on. He covers a lot of theory and proofs while not doing too many examples. His weight distribution of marks put way too much emphasis on the final. Good person but class could be structured and delivered better.

The lecture notes are challenging to follow and understand, making it difficult to grasp the material. Additionally, the test questions are quite difficult. The grade distribution is heavily weighted, with only 10% allocated to homework and 90% determined by midterms and finals, which puts significant pressure on exam performance.

Lecture notes are hard to read and lectures themselves are a little dry. He follows the textbook pretty closely and notes down in the lecture notes what parts of the textbook are omitted. I skipped every lecture and just read the textbook. 

Exams are pretty fair if you just do some textbook problems. Definitely make use of office hours.
If you complain about kamal pls go take ensc316 with bernhard. Do the example on the textbook, everything will sort out
Notes were not great and I didn't understand the structure of the course. The explanations were all over the place.
Stay away from this instructor
Aight
He does not scale. Class average was a C. Have fun with those notes!
Avoid at all cost

She does so many things to make your life easy, like allowing collaboration during quizzes, grace period policy,  and lectures on Zoom with recording if you don't want to go to class. Exams are fair and doable if you prepared for it. Pre-midterm material is almost trivial. Post-midterm material however is surprisingly challenging, so beware.

Atousa seems like a wonderful person to be around, but she is NOT fit for teaching. ENSC380 is a difficult course and her lectures teach you nothing. Her lecture notes will have the question, minimal work, and the answer and expect you to know how SHE got from A to B. She also can't explain topics to save her life. Avoid this prof.
Quizzes and tests are very easy;  Explains things very well; Generally supportive towards students.
I think she's improved her teaching skills since i took 220 with her, so gd enough
She refuses to curve!!!! no matter how many people fail, she'll never curve :(
Good luck. Try not to fail.

You can see from reading the comments that people either really like her classes or really hate them (or they think they are all right... jk). My own opinion is that her teaching is far too restricted, not giving the students enough freedom to learn the theory in their own way. And if she could only lose the powerpoint!! it is sooo not helpful!!!
No Comments

Atousa uses grades as a weapon to punish us for the low class attendance. Don't worry, the grade you get is not a reflection of how you are doing. I am a graduate student now; but I got D in her ENSC220 many years ago, but A- in the subsequent ENSC320. Also B+ in ENSC225 and B in ENSC325. Keep your heads up guys!

Honest opinion -> Dont take any courses with her. Her lectures are clear and make u feel that you understand stuff, but exams are brutal, really hard. From her teaching, you can never tell what is important to know and u get surprised in exams. I was scholorship holder but she ruined my gpa.My advice-> Avoid her if u can
Good teacher, but hard course. I was delightfully surprised when she offered a weekly tutorial using her spare time. Not many professors would do this since they don't get paid more.
No Comments

She needs to completely revise her teaching method. Her power point notes are a complete joke. She is a good person in general, but her teaching ability is one of the worse in the Engineering Department.

Knowledgeable professor that communicates well. Class coincides with his research area so you can ask any questions. Does many examples in class and homework is taken from the textbook so no curveballs. Exams are fair and reflective of the lecture and the homework.
Fair prof

His exams are fair and related to lecture examples. let you use two double side cheat sheets for the final and provided formulas. let the final worth more if you have improved from midterm. saved me from failing to a B. nice and patient in office hour, won't tell u the answer but will guide you to it. Will take more courses with him.

Not a bad prof. Lectures are kind of boring and sometimes even useless, however the midterm and final was VERY FAIR. Nothing he didn't teach was on the exam and told you what to study for beforehand. Very Helpful. Don't miss classes, although they're boring he sometimes writes examples that are not on the slides and could be on the exams.

His lectures are absolutely useless.  He uses PowerPoint presentations that come with the textbook.  What is most discouraging is that the few classes he taught without the PowerPoint were extremely useful!  Overall, he seems disinterested in teaching, and doesn't seem to put any effort into it.
If u hav a chance dont bother taking a class with him. U'll not understand 90% of what he's trying to say n during the rest 10% u missed lecture. So even if u attend lectures, won't help a bit.

your marks depend on the TA you are assigned. He believes the world is unfair, so the marking can be unfair too and doesn't make an attempt to scale the marks between TA. (i somewhat admire this even though i didn't get the easy TA)
boring lecture, hard tests
A very intelligent guy. His talking during the lecture seems boring, but he actually does a lot of trash talk. His exams are not really hard if you do pay attention in class.
"You Shall Not Pass!" - this guy is hard ! his exams are hard! plus the material is hard! but he's a nice guy, pretty friendly old man, and knows his stuff well
his history and projects sounds legendary. his class is ok.
hard final, easy midterm.. attend his class!!

Good prof, is very helpful answering questions after class. Tries to keep everything clear. Exams are challenging, but most of the problems are from textbook or previous exams. Go to class, pay attention, ask questions, do homework, and you'll do fine. The material is pretty cool.
He is very clear. Homework and class don't prepare you for the exams in any ways. His TA's are very helpful. Midterm and finals include mostly notes questions

Excellent prof!! Very clear. His exams are pretty challenging. Don't study the hw problems for the exams. Do that harder questions in the textbook and the hard lecture examples. Overall excellent professor.
Horrible prof, so hard......it's a purely math course
Please take 380 with him then QQ later

The most organized prof. loved his lectures - not very exciting, but very clear, logical, organized, and easy to follow. understanding of students level, and doesn't expect students to know everything beforehand. Not an easy course, but straight-forward and fair exams. just attending+studying the lectures thoroughly will probably give B or higher.
Attending lectures are worthwhile because his explanations are better than some other ensc profs.
